body_html:
I've checked math in: ExponentialFamily.entropy(), ExponentialFamily.kl_divergence(), a few of the .natural_params and .log_normalizer() implementations, and I've checked the tests.

This PR is mainly for testing: it provides alternative implementations for .entropy() and kl_divergence() and tests that our two implementations agree; it thus provides higher assurance of correctness than our existing Monte Carlo tests. The implementations in this PR are not used by default in any of our existing distributions.
body_text:
I've checked math in: ExponentialFamily.entropy(), ExponentialFamily.kl_divergence(), a few of the .natural_params and .log_normalizer() implementations, and I've checked the tests.
This PR is mainly for testing: it provides alternative implementations for .entropy() and kl_divergence() and tests that our two implementations agree; it thus provides higher assurance of correctness than our existing Monte Carlo tests. The implementations in this PR are not used by default in any of our existing distributions.
body:
I've checked math in: `ExponentialFamily.entropy()`, `ExponentialFamily.kl_divergence()`, a few of the `.natural_params` and `.log_normalizer()` implementations, and I've checked the tests.

This PR is mainly for testing: it provides alternative implementations for `.entropy()` and `kl_divergence()` and tests that our two implementations agree; it thus provides higher assurance of correctness than our existing Monte Carlo tests. The implementations in this PR are not used by default in any of our existing distributions.
